website_summaries.verdict: Boasting Apple AirPrint, automatic double-sided printing, and impressive performance for the price, the Canon Pixma MG3200 is a fine choice for shoppers looking for an inexpensive printer.
pros: The Canon Pixma MG3220 has Apple AirPlay wireless compatibility that eliminates installation speed bumps, and Canon's versatile imaging software to help you edit and organize your snapshot photos before printing
cons: Depending on your output frequency, the two-cartridge ink bay could boost the overall cost of ownership

customer_reviews.title: Works great- good deal
customer_reviews.text: Seen some complaints on this printers ink usage, you have got to be kidding me, this thing is fantastic compared to my last printer- the printer itself and the cartridges are cheaper than what I had been paying prior. Could the price of ink be less for this thing, absolutely, but I don't have any major gripes about it. The printer works quick, gets the job done, and I have had absolutely no problems with printing from my laptops, computer, iPhone or iPad using the wireless feature.
customer_reviews.author: tuhmairuh

customer_reviews.title: You can probably do better
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of purchasing this when what I really needed was an entry-level black and white laser printer. The laser printer is the best option if you're just printing concert tickets, travel information, basic hiking maps, etc. -- it is far cheaper (~1000 pages per cartridge), generally has a reputation for being more reliable, and prints much faster. My Canon got replaced when it began constantly printing blank pages when turned on. Engineering-wise, I expect a printer to last many years. Look into something else -- if you think laser is best, have a look at the entry level Brother printer. Perfect form factor to cram in a nook (no paper tray sticking out) for usage ~2x/mo
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Worst Canon printer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have owned multiple Canon printers for years and have loved every one of them. However, this has all changed. This particular printer has paper jams about 50% of the time I print/copy and the print head cannot ever get aligned, so bar codes or other graphical elements get completely distorted and each new line is shifted to the right or left a bit, making the document unusable/unreadable. I've run through all of the troubleshooting utilities but none of them work. So frustrated... :(
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: After using this printer for over a year now I can say I absolutely hate it! The printer ink cost is outrageous and almost costs as much as the printer itself. It prints incredibly slow and noisy!! Printing pictures sucks on this printer. The printer for some reason is always shown offline when connected wirelessly through my internet. So if you are looking for easy printing wirelessly get a different printer. Overall this printer for the money sucks and I would tell anyone and everyone to get a different printer. Spend an extra $50 dollars and you could actually be saving $1,000 a year on printer ink cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good Until It's Untimely Death...
customer_reviews.text: Though it worked great when it worked, it died faster than any other printer I've EVER had. I replaced my old printer not because it had died, but because there was such a great deal on this one and I wanted to have a printer and scanner in one instead of having to use two separate devices. Thankfully, I kept the old scanner. I think I may have even gotten the old printer back from my Mom when she wasn't using it any more. Time to go back to HP or another good printer manufacturer. I've learned my lesson with this one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vancko

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Canon builds trash product. This gem has a waste ink recovery pad. It has an internal counter that tells you when to clean the pads. However, you can not reset the counter. Consequently, you get an error message every time you try to print. Be prepared to throw this thing away shortly after you start using it. I contacted Canon and they were so sorry that they offered me 5 bucks off my next Canon purchase. Pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: saj

customer_reviews.title: Still Printing and Scanning!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer for a while now. Customer service has been great when we've called, and we honestly haven't had to call often. I scan and print frequently for business and for home, and it just keeps on going. Simple to use. I also like how we can print wirelessly. I highly recommend this printer/scanner/copier.
customer_reviews.author: PnkPnthr

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer A TON. I am a medical student and stuck in the mind set that I need printed notes. I print at least 10 pages a day and it keeps up well. I also refill my ink and with a little work, you can refill them many times before you have to go out and get new ones. Only downside is that it is a little loud and slow. This is not a bid deal for office printing, but gives my animals something to attack when I don't defend it. The print quality is good enough for office printing, but I won't be doing any photo prints anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: JasonHTX

customer_reviews.title: works well. setting up wireless is harder than it needs to be. prints nicely.
customer_reviews.text: this printer works very well once all the way set up. setting up the wireless should not be so hard in this day and age. my previous printer was a kodak all in one that had a screen that showed errors (words not weird flashy symbols) and made wireless setup WAY easier, i would buy another one of those in the future. also, i would prefer an auto feed for scanning and copying. but in a pinch and at a very economical price, this printer has been good to me.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wireless Printer And Works With Mac
customer_reviews.text: I have been a big fan of Canon printers ever since too many "other" brands' inkjets dried up in the Arizona heat. I use Mac computers and this works with both OSX 10.6 and 10.7. Nice quality photo prints and color copies. I can't comment yet about ink usage since I haven't emptied any yet. That is actually the only bad thing about it, in that the cartridges are not refillable by the consumer. That of course is just my way of complaining about outrageous printer ink in general. Good printer/scanner/copier and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb D

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replce an old flatbed scanner. Our Pixma4000 still works as well but we needed the scanning and fax ability of the newer product. I am not sure what the people who had problems setting this up were doing but I had it running on the first try in about 10 minutes including opening the box. We are mainly just using it to fax and scan untill the other canon printer runs out of ink so I can't comment on how long the ink lasts or how good pictures look. It does seem to print just fine the few times we have printed with it. It prints from the ipad and iphone just great too.
customer_reviews.author: AICD

customer_reviews.title: It's okay but....
customer_reviews.text: This printer does what is suppose to but there are features I don't like about it. First of all there is a thing that comes up on my start up for it that takes up half of my screen I can't figure out how to get from coming up on start up. The ink costs more than what I paid for the printer. I feel like I should get a new printer every couple of weeks. I go through a lot of ink. I bought this for a small business and I'm really looking into other options. I had a Brother printer I really liked but it wouldn't run on the Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: nightmare to try to get it to work
customer_reviews.text: I wish I hadn't purchased this. Even after I took forever to set it up (with my husband's help who works in the IT area)it still quit on me a couple of months later. Poor or no instructions. And looking on the websites for instructions was problematic. Unless you are an IT guru, please don't spend the $50 on this printer. Spend an extra 50 and buy something that has better reviews. I consider myself quite savvy when it comes to setting tech devices up and even after reading some bad reviews I decided to purchase it. I thought how could you go wrong with a cheap printer like that:( I was wrong!
customer_reviews.author: a1sell

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday printer
customer_reviews.text: We don't print photos very often, but for everyday usage, it's a great printer. Ink is always expensive, but there's always fast draft which helps conserve that. The only thing worth mentioning is that it goes to sleep and must be woken up before usage, which seems a bit counter intuitive for a wireless printer. Otherwise, a good, easy-to-use general needs printer.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Irving

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I very much like my Canon PIXMA MG3220. My only complain with it is that it is constantly trying to get me to do more with it than I want to do which is just basically print a picture now and then and print a letter or document that I have written. I am not interested in all of the other stuff it can do. It is very compact and I like that. To benefit from its compact design one does however have to keep it empty of paper but loading it with paper when you do need to print something is no big deal at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Thome

customer_reviews.title: Really nice printer, but.....
customer_reviews.text: Could not get the owner's manual to come up on my screen. Other software didn't load right, either. Printer is pretty user-friendly, so I got it to work. Had a little problem with envelopes. Would have helped if I could have had a manual to look at. Gorgeous copy, though. Found out the hard way that it prints wireless, but if you want to scan, you have to hook up to your computer via USB port. Luckily, I have a laptop that I can move to the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Creamer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy for use with an Ipad
customer_reviews.text: Set up was reasonably easy after I made a USB connection. Prints fine from 3 different HP laptops all with windows 8.Also prints fine from an IPhone 4s. I have been online with canon's help desk trying to get it to print from my latest generation I Pad. I followed their first set of instructions and it still won't print. the I Pad recognizes the printer but when I hit print nothing happens . I don't want to send it back----yet. If anyone has suggestions let me know
customer_reviews.author: tomab1933

customer_reviews.title: Ink eater and expensive to replace
customer_reviews.text: I ignored other reviews warning about the amount of ink used by the printer and the expense to replace because I rarely print from home. However, even with extremely low usage, it constantly says low on ink and won't print until replaced (ink is $45 for black and color). It's seriously not worth the cost or effort to continuously replace the ink. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: justme101

customer_reviews.title: Tech Dummy
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem with my wifi connection but had the devil of a time getting it to talk to my computer. Somehow, some way a light bulb turned on and I noticed an instruction that hadn't penetrated my struggling gray cells. Bingo! Not only talking but chatting away. Love My Color Garden and learning so many things new to me. So fun, it's almost like a game - and I win! My older Pixma printer was working fine but out of date plus I wanted to go wireless. Happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: KU Jayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Easiest printer to set up
customer_reviews.text: When I first unwrapped my printer I thought it was going to be a headache, but after I unpacked the printer and followed the instruction on the CD it was very easy. The copies were very clear and putting the ink cartridges in is simple, There was a page of instruction that did say you need to upgrade Windows 7 to 8, but it was wrong. I was able to connect wireless and follow the instruction perfectly well with Windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: REALLY NICE PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I really like this printer. I had never had a wireless and it works great and was relatively easy to set up. I used to have 3 printers from another company. There was certainly nothing really wrong with them, but then bought a Canon. Well now I have 4 printers and 3 are a Canon. The other is a specialty printer from Olympus that will only do photos. I really like the Canon's and they just last and last. Why do I have 3? Probably insanity works it's way in there somewhere lol. Regardless, great printer!!
customer_reviews.author: Connie J. Devine

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer. Scanner a bit slow.
customer_reviews.text: This printer/scanner replaced a relatively new Kodak printer that crapped out after only a years use. The Cannon printer/scanner has been very reliable and good print quality. The only negative thing I can say about the printer is that the scanner scans a little slower than the Kodak but I can live with the slower scanning speed. The WiFi connection is perfect on this printer. After installing the printer and software I just leave the printer on full time. I can print from any device I own, laptop, phone, tablet, or the desktop that it's connected to. All and all a good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: David Gregory

customer_reviews.title: This printer worked great until 2 weeks out of the one year warranty
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great until 2 weeks out of the one year warranty. It gave me an error message I couldn't find on google, so I called Canon. It took the agent a few minutes to figure it out, then she told me I could ship it to the nearest Canon repair facility (4 hours away) or they'd give me a discount on a new one. Since I got it at a discount and with gift cards, I can't be too mad but if I'd paid the full $65 price tag out of my pocket I'd be annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This machine new but defective and only found out when ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine new but defective and only found out when I started to use it and it immediately said to contact administrator Even though, I admit, I was past the 30 day return policy.....this dealer would not take it back..even though it was defective. A Lesson for me...never buy a printer online....incase something goes wrong...there is no recourse....
customer_reviews.author: Jane N.

customer_reviews.text: This one broke after about three months of use, I didn't bother trying to return it as they are so cheap, and it wasn't worth my time to speak with customer service, ship it out (probably a fortune) and wait for a new one, as I'm a student and always need a personal printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer to pair with my chrome book but I didn't realize that the printer didn't have cloud print so they weren't as compatible as they could have been but that's my own fault. The printer was easy to set up, ink easy to install, and it printed beautifully. My only issue with it in the short time I had it was the paper in put and out put trays look a little flimsy and would probably break off pretty easily. But it was a cheaper printer for all that it does so I think it's worth the money, jut don't leave the trays hanging out.
customer_reviews.author: Karley Ann

customer_reviews.title: easily installation
customer_reviews.text: The printer was received very quickly and was extremely easy to install, in spite of the fact that I consider myself techno-challenged. However, no matter what I tried, (both printer alignment and computer alignment-twice) the print head would not align. Called tech support, she gave one tip which didn't help. In the process, I decided to change cartridges, and voila, problem solved. My only hope is that this problem doesn't happen frequently, as I only have so much money to spend on Ink. Outside of that, I have no other issues. The printer is a little noisy, a little slow, and the paper trays are a little flimsy, but for no more than it cost, I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: shelley igney

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Chrome, now I'm stuck with it !!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and my Samsung Chrome notebook isn't compatible. So I wanted to return it (used prime membership to get it) and it would cost me more to ship it back for a return than the printer cost. Cheaper to keep it. It would be like throwing the money away. I have owned it for two months and still have not been able to use it for anything I own. I am going to have to sell it. The seller indicated that I had to pay to ship it back when I clicked the return button. Not happy with this at all. So I don't know how to rate the product when I can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Fioretti

customer_reviews.title: Good, but no USB
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well, is pretty easy to hook up and get running, prints quickly and has decent quality. I haven't tried photo prints yet, though. I didn't realize when I bought it that it doesn't have a USB port or smart card port so that you can print files from a zip drive. So, while I really miss that, it's really my own fault for not paying enough attention to the description.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Collett

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful this company is Shady
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a Cannon printer. Used it for 5 days and it kept dropping it's wireless connection and it was two feet from the Router. I decided to return it. Two weeks later after several emails I received a $14.70 return for a $61 dollar printer. There answer was the ink was open. They keep the ink and the printer and I loose 50 bucks. Their return policy is not documented. Stay away from these guys. A fly by night company.
customer_reviews.author: john vanburen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but some frustration
customer_reviews.text: The printer is excellent and I am pleased with its performance. However.Cannon has done a poor job of providing instructions on explaining the extra features. I have gone on the internet to down load instructions. I was unable to pull up what I felt i was looking after. Consequently two features are not functioning. I guess I will have to have one of my family members interpret it for me which is an inconvenience. Shame on Cannon.Walt james
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: It's a Cannon
customer_reviews.text: Just the title should be enough. It's a Cannon so you know it's a quality unit. This one was a gift but we have 3 other Cannon printers in our house and we have had no issues with any of them. They are all used regularly and work pretty much flawlessly. I do recommend getting off brand ink, purchased on Amazon. It will save you a ton of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Printer has major and recurrent connection problems
customer_reviews.text: This printer does not function whether connected via WiFi or even a cable. I resorted to the second when the WiFi connection dropped repeatedly. I followed the directions carefully, and things worked immediately after, but the connection to the printer was inevtiably dropped. If you would like to reinstall software each time you need to print, by all means, choose Canon. Note also that I left a similar review on Canon's website, which they scrubbed, claiming it did not relate to the product. This printer has been a disaster. I have never had anything remotely like the problems with this one with any other I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Malone

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the box and removing all of the orange tape the unit did not work. The display flashes an error code and computer does not detect when connected. Canon says that I have to send them the unit and they will replace it with a refurbished unit. I don't recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: J Zumbee

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is awesome
customer_reviews.text: It works reliably, and it's really nice being able to print from my laptop while I'm sitting in my living room, without removing the laptop from its power cord & connecting it to a hard-line printer. The only issue I had was, it never did detect my wireless, and I had to set it up manually, which was less than obvious. It took me a couple days to get it working. Now that it's set up, it works fine, though.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Krisko

customer_reviews.title: The little printer that could
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this printer. It was easy to connect to the wireless and now all the computers in my home are connected and print to it. It works equally well with Macs and PCs. I have not printed photos yet, but I have printed some color letterhead and it looks great. Quality seems high. I've printed up to 20 pages at a time with no problems, though when I tried printing a 70 page presentation paper got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Grilled Sardine

customer_reviews.title: The price was right!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer cost me about the same as replacing the ink in my HP 8600. I was having a problem with my 8600 so I tried this. This Canon is working just as good except it doesn't have Fax. Its Scanner is the quietest I've had. I've never tried printing wireless before and this first attempt was a failure. I don't care enough to get tech support, but I think that my wireless system is not compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this printer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because my printer broke. The first unit i got didnt work so i exchanged it only to get a second printer with the same problem... maybe because im using it on a mac but the printer wont detect paper in the paper tray no matter no much or little paper or what type of paper in the paper tray. Am able to get one page to come out by pushing the "black" or "color" button but the problem just comes back.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: Wireless, good quality printing, for $59!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first wireless printer we've owned. Works like a charm. Chose this for price and was impressed with other recommendations. Only been using it a week or so - no problems. It does have a very mechanical sound and is on the slow (to get to a ready state) side. But we aren't heavy printers. Have not tested the scanner or copier yet. Have not used up too much ink yet. It's seems to be a great purchase so far. If problems arise, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Kodak printer for years, but they were discontinued. I was still able to buy ink for it though. It was not printing very well because I had it for over five years. This Canon printer is awesome! The items I print in color come out super bright, no fuzzies around the photo or chart. It turns itself off, which good, but it's taken me awhile to get used to that. I'd totally recommend this printer. Price and quality are both fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Wall

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE our Cannon!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my wife side the States but she missed it so much and loves it so I bought her another one for here in the USA. User friendly, easy to set up, can connect via wifi with our iPhones and laptops, and we are very pleased with the printer! It came in two days and the black ink printed out quite a few pages before it told us the ink is low. (about 50 pages)
customer_reviews.author: Erkan U

customer_reviews.title: There are better ones out there.
customer_reviews.text: I just missed my window for returning this printer. I didn't have a great use for it until this last week. Now I see that it is very slow and loud. I often get a "communication" error when trying to print from another room. It works - just now that well. If you pay about $20 more you can get a much better printer. If I was able to return this, I would go for the HP wireless inkjet. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful printer
customer_reviews.text: I am usually not one to leave reviews but this product is so terrible, I felt obligated. This printer has major problems recognizes when I have paper loaded in it. I have to position the paper in such a perfect way for it to recognize it. Then it will print one page and say that the paper is empty, even though there is still abundant paper loaded. I will then have to position the paper again in a perfect way so that it is recognized. This process goes on and on ad naseum. So frustrating. Honestly might throw this printer off my balcony out of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: WiFi printing fails often
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer 5 months ago. As long an your computer is attached to printer by USB cable the printer is good. I wanted a wireless printer for our home network. It will work on the network for a while, after a day or two it drops the network and shows as unavailable. To reset the WiFi connection I have had to use the installation disk and it takes about 15 minutes each time. Numerous contacts with Canon has not helped. The final straw was when I lost a gift certificate that could only be printed once, and the printer failed. This printer has now been replaced.
customer_reviews.author: DeWayne Hofer

customer_reviews.title: Another fantastic Canon product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer/scanner! It's great all around. I turned over the hardest part, getting it to talk with the WiFi, to my darling wife. So, I can't really tell you how it was to hook up, but the end result is awesome. Just being able to take a picture in the backyard, select the printer on my iPhone, and print the picture I just took is really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Totally ImAussieBull

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer and plan to keep it, however I ordered it to use wirelessly with an IPad. My complaint would be finding an iPad app to use with the printer for wireless capability. It was advertised as " works with IPad " and "wireless" but I am having difficulty finding an app that actually works with this particular printer. The general Pixma app does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Small Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this product. I have had it for about 3 months now, and the black ink still has not run out. I get my ink from Amazon, which has the best price. It is quiet, prints when I want it to, and has good energy saving features. I have two devices hooked up to this, both wirelessly, which works flawlessly. No problems yet!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this printer for photos. I use it for printing my stickers. I got used to my previous printer (HP 1400 series) and the way the colors looked after printing. Just be prepared that this printer might adjust those colors for the better or worse. Depending on what you're expecting. Hard to explain I guess. Easy to install and I love the Air Print feature although I've been pranked already with it. haha. Obviously I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: R F

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer
customer_reviews.text: Cover is a little flimsy so I think we'll have to be careful with it. Not as fast and solid as our full size all in one wired printer but so far this is turning out to be a good printer, and I love being able to print from my iPad and iPhone! I had to call canon for help installing it wirelessly and I received excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ocain

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer, esp for the price. Very easy install. I could not get it to sync with my WPS button from my internet router so I had to use the disk, but that wasn't at all a big deal. For some it may be, which is why I docked it a star. The paper feeds well (no issues so far) the ink is clear. It's light, saves space, inexpensive, and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: mchere23

customer_reviews.title: Canon printer
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer,and the fact that it is wireless.It is not the fastest printer.But it is a great value.It does not have a fax, but what alot of people don't realize is that Windows comes with a fax that will integrate with your printer.I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very inexpensive and worth every cent. It works great. I really have no complaints at all. I own a business and need to take photos and print them out every so often. The picture quality is great (as long as I use good photo paper). It copies and scans with no difficulty. I would most definitely recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: LPN78

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection, wastes ink, terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this printer it had 4.5 stars on Amazon. This is literally the worst printer Ive ever had. I have to run the utility and connect it via USB once a week to re-setup the wireless. TERRIBLE user interface and software. Blasts through ink as well. Don't buy unless you are looking for a cheap printer that you print one page a month on and you dont mind having a wired connection. I'll give it a star cause it looks pretty.
customer_reviews.author: David Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good value
customer_reviews.text: The printer does as it should and without any fuss. Printing, scanning and copying are all quite easy. I didn't have a disc drive in my netbook to run the software that comes on the CD. No problem - I called Canon customer service and they talked me through getting the necessary info and drivers from their website. Excellent customer service, almost no waiting time, etc.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: I love my printer!
customer_reviews.text: I am trading up to this printer from my previous canon printer. i like the canon printers as the cartridges have more ink than the HP printers. The copies are clear and clean. The printer is working great and I love the wireless feature. No more being tied to my desk. The cartridges are inexpensive and seem to last much longer than the HP printers. i say kudos to Canon!
customer_reviews.author: sizatt

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy sloppy sloppy
customer_reviews.text: This thing was doa. It just would not work on windows 8. I have two machines and I tried it on both. It simply would not accept the driver issued by non else than canon itself. Returned after two days because I could not print a single page. The problem is NOT windows 8. It is with canon.
customer_reviews.author: HSPevolved Archer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless printing but not useful for Android use
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great and was very easy to set up. However, it advertises that you can print from your iphone or android device. Kinda true, but not really. It seems to fully support airprint, which is great for Apple users. However, if you have an android based devise you can only print pictures from your gallery, and canon produced pdf. You cannot print documents, emails, webpages, pdf's, google docs, etc. That was what I wanted it for mainly, so I am returning it. I think the packaging is a bit deceptive. It was a nice printer, but really not functional for Android printing.
customer_reviews.author: J. McLean

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for sure!~!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty little printer and you can't beat the price. Have had a bit of trouble running it wirelessly but that could be me! Output tray is not very durable or big enough and most of my printing--especially multiple pages-- ends up on the floor. Still a great buy with very clear images!
customer_reviews.author: Margi S

customer_reviews.title: Affordable wireless printing!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, great print quality for this bargain wireless option. Shipped immediately, arrived promptly was excellently packaged and in perfect condition. Easy to install and great instructions for setting up to your wireless network. Includes software and cable for non wifi printing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Experience of old guy(70's)
customer_reviews.text: My wifwe has a wireless ready computer and the old printer which is one of the first wireless quit communicating with her computer. Mine is old and hard wired so I didn't want to treash it. I am of old gereration and not computer savy, but can follow good directions. Decided to try the Canon myself and after carefully following directions in hookup, it worked without any problems. It scans with order from computer too. Small and doesn't take much room in our clutered space! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: David beverly DMD

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I take online college course. I wasn't sure that a printer was something that I would use often but since I've had it, I use it at least 5 times a week. I don't know how I was doing it before I got my printer. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone anyone in college. It's not cheaply made, but it's a good price if you buy it through here. You can also buy an extended warranty for a good price
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fox

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer!
customer_reviews.text: -Fast printing -Easy set-up with Wi-Fi -AirPrint is a huge +++ -Great print quality -Double-sided printing! I've been a Canon printer fan since 2001, but I have NEVER purchased a Canon since then (because that printer STILL works and is AWESOME). If you're contemplating- just buy it. It's a great deal and you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma MG3220 Wireless Printer with scanner and copier
customer_reviews.text: I have the printer up and running I had a small glitch at first as I did not read instructions as well as I should have. The printer prints well in black and color and is not as quiet as some printers but is acceptable. I would buy the printer again as Amazon has good prices and free shipping
customer_reviews.author: Jane S. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Printer for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Got a good Amazon deal on this printer for my daughter. Setup wasn't too bad - it came with an excellent quick setup guide. Print quality looks good. The only issue I had with it was that the output tray extended to far out of the front of the printer that it could potentially get bumped and broken on your standard student desk.
customer_reviews.author: S. Caudill

customer_reviews.title: It eats ink like crazy and is hard to work with - scanning ...
customer_reviews.text: It eats ink like crazy and is hard to work with - scanning is pure hell. It is very slow and often unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice buy, but can't get the wireless printing to work on any of my computers / iphones. We have all mac items (2 ipads, 2 iphones and 2 macs) and it won't work on anything. Just have to walk computer over to printer and plug the usb cord into the computer and it comes up instantly. For the money I will just keep it for that function only.
customer_reviews.author: W.M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because if the low price ($56) and the WiFi connectivity. I was looking for decent speed and quality of printing which is standard nowadays. WIFI connectivity makes no sense on this printer. After initial set-up the communication with the printer is lost almost every single day, and I have to redo all the setting and installation steps to be able to get the printer online status via WIFI. Useless. you get what you pay for. If you are mainly interested in wireless printing, pay a bit more and get something else (Epson or Lexmark). Would definitively not recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Matos

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: We got this printer to use for my son and his schooling projects. From setup to use we have not had a single issue with this printer and are using it for the school projects and far more. We found the quality of printing to be sufficient for pictures and printing off nice papers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Printer
customer_reviews.text: I already have another Cannon printer. and this one is just a little better.They both do a great job. The PIXMA MG 3220 is faster then my current printer. Only down side is I found out later that I could have purchased this a Walmart for less money
customer_reviews.author: G. Horen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with the printer and will be returning it in original packing. The print quality was poor and I discovered that it's not really compatible with Windows 7. It was suggested that I upgrade to Window 8, which I do not want to do. The printer seemed unresponsive and sluggish. Many times I had to re-circulate the power in order to print one sheet of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Pelosi

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this printer. I was able to setup and was printing wirelessly from my Macbook in a short time. I have had no issues and it works better than my previous printer from a major printer and pc manufacturer. I can even print from my iPhone and my IPad so life is good. The print speed and quality are good. The ink replacement is easy, so no advance degrees in structural engineering or stress load bearing dynamics required.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, however cheap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these: one for a university bound daughter and another for a corporate apartment. Although the university use was much heavier than my occasional use, both were broken about the same time. Two failures under two different users tells me that the printer is flawed.
customer_reviews.author: ClydeLane

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer, had every feature we needed: wireless, AirPrint, double sided printing, and photo quality. The scanner is very easy to use and works wirelessly. The wireless connection was super easy to set up, and we haven't had any issues printing on it. I definitely recommend this printer if you're looking for a solid, jack-of-all-trades home printer under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Adam G. Bender

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had time to use all the available features on this machine yet. That is why I did not rate the paper yet. However, I have printed text and have been very pleased! It has also scanned old pics into my computer and they have looked better than the original, so the computer has less to do to improve them!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Price-Hobday

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this printer for almost a year now. Not only is the quality of this printer quite good, I don't get the same problem I do from Epson and HP printers where the ink dries up; Canon is pretty good with that issue. Only thing I don't like is the expensive printer cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Does what I wanted for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: I mainly got this for the Airprint capability and double-sided printing. It works perfectly. It is a little bigger than other printers I have had, but that is not a huge issue because of the wifi. I have not printed anything with detail, so I cannot attest to that, but as a document printer that prints from Apple devices, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lucia

customer_reviews.title: Programmer of 35 years endorses this printer
customer_reviews.text: My first printer was a TRS-80 LINE PRINTER IV. It was 1979. This Canon MG3220 is incredible in both features and value. For under $70, to have color, wireless and duplex printing? The drivers are easy to install. Works reliably. The ink cartridges seem to be more moderately priced than the competitors' as well. I am very happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Figgis

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's suppose to do lol. I have yet to print photo's in it because well my customers always seem to wanna go digital and skip the print outs O__o. All and all I love it and prints fast and easy. I also love how this printer uses every last drop of the ink in the cartridge before it says it is completely empty.
customer_reviews.author: RAD1CAL

customer_reviews.title: Having lots of problems with it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too happy with this printer. I've had trouble with print quality, getting the wi-fi set up, scanning, and even good old fashioned printer jams. It also comes with an obnoxious set of software that clutters up your desktop and most of which doesn't seem to do anything useful.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Bayliss

customer_reviews.title: Works as directed, but a pain to set-up
customer_reviews.text: The printer function prints like a well made Canon printer. The set-up is a pain especially when you are trying to set-up or use with only an tablet over wi-fi. I ended up first installing on a PC and it was a much simple process from there. I would not buy it again because so many other printers have an easier set-up process, even though the printing aspect was satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: jestes12

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This thing prints like a champ. Printers are a touchy subject for me. Ink can become very costly, and a lot of printers are designed to make even your dullest essay print out with the quality of a family portrait. This doesn't. It recognizes that you are in charge, that you have a wallet that isn't bottomless, and prints things accordingly. If you want black and white, you'll get black and white. If you want it fast... you get the idea. We've used it for 1.5 semesters now and have only had to change the black ink once!
customer_reviews.author: FouFromage

customer_reviews.title: Paper loading problems
customer_reviews.text: Printer struggles to load paper, it says it is out of paper when there is a stack properly loaded, then will suck up many sheets at one and jam. Not sure if I just have a lemon or if this is common to this printer. Haven't stopped to call Canon and find out. I also had to reload the printer as the first time it didn't install properly and had lots of connection issues. I simply couldn't get it to print, it would say it was offline when it wasn't. That was sorted with a second install though.
customer_reviews.author: Amica73

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. Output is good quality print and initial ink cartridges lasted longer than I expected. I bought the printer in July of 2013 and just needed to replace the ink this month. I'm in school full time and print quite a bit every week, so this was very good.
customer_reviews.author: royalheir

customer_reviews.title: Pixma MG3220 Color Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for about 8 months now. About 4 months after purchasing it, it started to have issues with feeding paper. Every time I print, the printer reports it is out of paper. It struggles to pick the first page every time. A couple of retries and helping the paper with my hand usually works. Cleaning it doesn't seem to help. I seem to have this issue with every inkjet printer. This one is no different. Everything else works well, prints quickly, scans a nice quality photo quickly, and wireless set up is not too difficult. The ink lasted about 7 months. Not bad.
customer_reviews.author: William Friend

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It took four tries to download the ton of software that comes with this printer (each try is 15 minutes) and the print quality is poor. No saturation, no contrast. Just weak prints. I am sending it back. I went through the head cleaning, and alignment routine -- no dice. Don't waste your money on this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Casan

customer_reviews.title: Kinda sucks
customer_reviews.text: You have to plug in an eithernet cable from he printer to your computer to set up the wifi and the navigation on the display is really poorly designer. It dose support apple Airport and that is why i got it.... but I would go for a more expensive model now that I had to call the company to set up the wifi... this one sucks! Its not plug and play!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M. Wickemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the space I needed it to fit in. Have not had any problems with it. Prints beautifully, scans and copies with ease. Seems to not waste ink as I had it for several months before needing to replace the cartridges that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good printer.
customer_reviews.text: Prints well for the price. One gripe: Sometimes the print output falls onto the floor, even with both shelf extenders in the extended position.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Cal

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: junk, pure and simple. insanely difficult to set up despite being a simple device. Necessary software is "no longer available" on line. Do not buy this product. I may never buy anything from Canon again. I should have checked the reviews at Canon's own site before ordering - big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Not to pleased with this printer. The paper is constantly jamming. I have no idea why but it is extremely irritating. If it try to print more than one page at a time its like the printer gets overwhelmed and cant handle it. Like i said, you get what you pay for. Cheap price, cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: mm

customer_reviews.title: Great Light-Duty Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer for "every-day" kinds of printing. The printer consistently produced images of good quality. Attaching this printer to the network was easy. I highly recommend this printer for light duty requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Eliott Mendelson

customer_reviews.title: Love the Iphone/ Ipad connectability..
customer_reviews.text: Good quality printer, easy to use, cost efficient, only negative is wireless setup usually takes 2-3 attempts, love the ipad / iphone compatability.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lounsbury

customer_reviews.title: horrible print quality
customer_reviews.text: I gave it one star because I could not give it any less...the quality of the prints is horrible even at high photo priting setting. Took photos w/a proffesional digital camera and the prints look like i took them w/a cheap 1megapixel cell phone. I tried printinng a variety of photos and they all came out looking like garbage and you can't print from the ipad or cell phone it will not connect yet it connects wirelessly w/my laptop. This printer is a piece of crap...really suprised never have a problem w/cannon...sending this garbage back asap!!
customer_reviews.author: monica magana

customer_reviews.title: Easy and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I am fully enjoying my new Pixma. I have had another pixma that gave up the ghost after about 7 years of faithful service. Though it only cost about $60, it is an upgrade for me, since I can send the request for printing from anywhere in the house, it is a step saver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Coffelt

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Hooked this up in a snap, and can use it for my desktop and my laptop wirelessly. It's a lifesaver and a very nice looking printer. About the same space is taken up as other large printers, but it looks sleek and elegant. Prints perfectly. Ink comes with it, one black and one color.
customer_reviews.author: Konspiracy Kitty

customer_reviews.title: It was being used pretty much exclusively for color printing and perhaps didn't get ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about a month although it could never seem to hold a Wi-Fi signal beyond one print job. Now it doesn't work at all. It was being used pretty much exclusively for color printing and perhaps didn't get enough use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B.

customer_reviews.title: This is such a good printer and so neat that it is automatic
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good printer and so neat that it is automatic, wireless. The only thing is the ink cartridges seem to be more expensive and they seem to need more ink. It is a very reasonable price to purchase so it is very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: glorious

customer_reviews.title: It's a printer. A necessary evil. This one ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a printer. A necessary evil. This one is alright. We refill the ink at costco and my only real complaints are the software used to interact with the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: really solid printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid photo printer. Only reason it is not 5 stars is that the software is large and slow, but the prints are very beautiful. I have not utilized the full bed capacity but 8.5X11 prints are crisp and clean. They look professionally done. Ink usage is much less than I anticipated. After 5 full page prints the tanks are barely showing usage.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: I'm not real happy with mine.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several problems with this printer. I always seem to get errors when trying to print something. After several tries without me doing nothing but keeping on resubmitting, it works.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Ulrich

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MG3220 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner and Copier (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
feature_bullets: Built-in automatic 2-sided printing helps the environment and can cut your paper usage by up to 50%
AirPrint enabled! Print wirelessly from your iPhone, iPad or iPod touch directly to your MG3220, no drivers needed!
My Image Garden software makes organizing and printing your photos fun and easy with great facial recognition, Fun Filters, Calendar Organization, Automatic Layout Suggestions and so much more!
FastFront feature makes is easy to change both ink and paper right from the front of the printer
